a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 4 + 3 * x powr 2 - 7 * x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 2 * x - 1"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x"
shows  "R x = x powr 2 - 2 * x + 8"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the quotient when $x^4 + 3x^2 - 7x$ is divided by $x^2 + 2x - 1.$ The final Answer is x^2 - 2x + 8
 ### Proof
 The long division is shown below. \[ \begin{array}{c|cc ccc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^2} & -2x & +8 \\ \cline{2-6} x^2 + 2x - 1 & x^4 & & +3x^2 & -7x &  \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^4} & +2x^3 & -x^2 \\ \cline{2-4}
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -2x^3 & +4x^2 & -7x \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -2x^3 & -4x^2 & +2x \\ \cline{3-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & +8x^2 & -9x & \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} &  & +8x^2 & +16x & -8 \\ \cline{4-6}
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} &  &  & -25x & +8 \\ \end{array} \]Thus, the quotient is $\boxed{x^2 - 2x + 8}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 4 + 3 * x powr 2 - 7 * x"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 2 * x - 1"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x"
shows  "R x = x powr 2 - 2 * x + 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given the function $P(x) = x^4 + 3x^2 - 7x$ and $Q(x) = x^2 + 2x - 1$. If $P(x)$ is a divisor of $Q(x)$ and $P(x) = Q(x) * R(x)$, find the function $R(x)$. The final answer is $R(x) = x^2 - 2x + 8$.
